George Washington.education: The equivalent of an elementary school education

John Adams.birth_place: North Precinct of Braintree (now Quincy), Massachusetts

James Madison.education: College of New Jersey (now Princeton University, graduated 1771)

Andrew Jackson.birth_place: Waxhaw area, on North Carolina-South Carolina border

William Henry Harrison.resting_place: William Henry Harrison Memorial State Park, North Bend, Ohio
William Henry Harrison.birth_place: Berkeley plantation, Charles City County, Virginia

Zachary Taylor.resting_place: Zachary Taylor National Cemetery, near Louisville, Kentucky

Millard Fillmore.resting_place: Forest Lawn Cemetery, Buffalo, New York
Millard Fillmore.education: Six months of grade school; read law in 1822

Franklin Pierce.resting_place: Old North Cemetery, Concord, New Hampshire
nickname: Young Hickory of the Granite Hills

Ulysses S. Grant.resting_place: Grant's Tomb, New York, New York
Ulysses S. Grant.education: U.S. Military Academy, West Point, New York (graduated 1843)

Rutherford B. Hayes.resting_place: Spiegel Grove State Park, Fremont, Ohio
children: Webb C. Hayes and Rutherford P. Hayes

James A. Garfield.education: Western Reserve Eclectic Institute (now Hiram College), Williams College (graduated 1856)

Woodrow Wilson.education: College of New Jersey (now Princeton University), graduated 1879

Dwight D. Eisenhower.education: U.S. Military Academy, West Point, New York (graduated 1915)

John F. Kennedy.career: Author, U.S. Navy Officer, Journalist, Public Official

Lyndon B. Johnson.education: Southwest Texas State Teachers College (now Texas State University-San Marcos), graduated 1930; Georgetown Law School, attended 1934

Richard Nixon.education: Whittier College (1934); Duke University Law School (1937)

Gerald Ford.education: University of Michigan (1935); Yale University Law School (1941)

Jimmy Carter.education: Georgia Southwestern College, 1941-1942; Georgia Institute of Technology, 1942-1943; United States Naval Academy, 1943-1946 (class of 1947); Union College, 1952-1953
Jimmy Carter.career: Soldier; Farmer, Warehouseman, Public Official, Professor

Bill Clinton.education: Georgetown University (1968), attended Oxford University (1968-1970), Yale Law School (1973)

Donald Trump.career: Businessman, Real Estate Developer, Television Personality

Joe Biden.education: University of Delaware (B.A., 1965), Syracuse University Law School (J.D., 1968)
Joe Biden.career: Lawyer, US Senator from Delaware (1973-2009), Vice President (2009-2017)
